body: Ricardo, Looking at your energy balance, it seems that your model has such a high intensity of people heat sources that it never actually gets the chance to need active heating: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/ycvwLIslca48U-RXPCqUYiJRY7NnbL4jGy1WUfmi2fogY-thSPJePBK1mCl1diYVFL3Em*Of**us*HNhaC57f57HE1-GW43G/HotBoxEBal.JPG) Now that we have fixed the issue with the Heating Design Day setpoint, this high intensity of people heat is the reason why you don't have any heating load.  Perhaps your case of a very small, largely adiabatic test box with so many people in it is not too realistic.  Or perhaps it is and I don't know your project well.  All I can say is that there is nothing wrong with how the energy model is running.  It's just doing what you tell it to do here. -Chris
